item.description: <!DOCTYPE html> A guide to robotics Comfy Academy A friendly guide to robotics Robots are created in our own image, so they are simple to understand by nature. The brain Every robot, just like human, has a brain to control all operations. This is often a Raspberry Pi computer. The Raspberry Pi is a credit-card-sized, affordable, and highly versatile computer. It's the perfect choice for various robotic projects. The Raspberry Pi comes with Wi-Fi functionality, enabling you to remotely control your robot using the ComfySpace app.

<!DOCTYPE html> Swiper Slideshow Comfy Academy How to build a robot? In this article, you will learn how to turn your idea into a robot, remotely controlled with the Comfy Space application. Meet Jax! To best understand the process, let me introduce Jax - an aspiring robotic maker! We will follow his process of turning an idea into a tangible robot. Original image by Raspberry Pi Foundation Final words Hello, folks!

A few examples of robots in real life The limbs Robots can sometimes perform an action: a car moving, a light turns on, or a speaker producing sounds.
